snippet: The new program NJPAC Stage Exchange commissions plays and promises staged readings and eventually full productions in Newark.
abstract: New Jersey Performing Arts Center collaborates with others in theater community to offer Stage Exchange, development series for New Jersey playwrights; unique program commissions plays, with stipulation they must be set in state and address social issues, and guarantees works will have full production; three plays are slated for upcoming season with first, Sanism by David Lee White, set for production in 2017.
lead_paragraph: The new program NJPAC Stage Exchange commissions plays and promises staged readings and eventually full productions in Newark.

headline.print_headline: A Reading and Then a Production. That’s a Promise.
headline.main: New Jersey Series Frees Some Playwrights From ‘Developmental Hell’
